intro: Alomia chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí alomia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of western Panama. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
